sect2.title: Introduction to tcpwrappers
sect2.para: The tcpwrappers package provides daemon wrapper programs that report the name of the client requesting network services and the requested service.

listitem.para: Required patch (Fixes some build issues and adds building of a shared library):

sect2.title: Installation of tcpwrappers
sect2.para: Install tcpwrappers with the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../tcp_wrappers-&tcpwrappers-version;-shared_lib_plus_plus-1.patch && make REAL_DAEMON_DIR=/usr/sbin STYLE=-DPROCESS_OPTIONS linux && make install

sect3.title: Config files
sect3.para: File protections: the wrapper, all files used by the wrapper, and all directories in the path leading to those files, should be accessible but not writable for unprivileged users (mode 755 or mode 555). Do not install the wrapper set-uid.
Then perform the following edits on the /etc/inetd.conf configuration file:

screen.userinput: finger stream tcp nowait nobody /usr/sbin/in.fingerd in.fingerd
finger stream tcp nowait nobody /usr/sbin/tcpd in.fingerd

note.para: The finger server is used as an example here.

sect3.para: Similar changes must be made if xinetd is used, with the emphasis being on calling /usr/sbin/tcpd instead of calling the service daemon directly, and passing the name of the service daemon to tcpd.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The tcpwrappers package contains tcpd, tcpdchk, tcpdmatch, try-from and safe_finger.

sect3.title: tcpd
sect3.para: tcpd is the main access control daemon for all Internet services, which inetd or xinetd will run instead of running the requested service daemon.

sect3.title: tcpdchk
sect3.para: tcpdchk is a tool to examine a tcpd wrapper configuration and report problems with it.

sect3.title: tcpdmatch
sect3.para: tcpdmatch is used to predict how the tcp wrapper would handle a specific request for a service.

sect3.title: try-from
sect3.para: try-from can be called via a remote shell command to find out if the host name and address are properly recognized.

sect3.title: safe_finger
sect3.para: safe_finger is a wrapper for the finger utility, to provide automatic reverse name lookups.
